meanings.definition: A person who engages in wrecking or destroying property.
meanings.sent1: The wreckers were caught red-handed vandalizing the abandoned building.
meanings.sent2: The community was concerned about the presence of wreckers in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous wreckers thought it would be fun to knock over the sandcastle.
meanings.sent4: The wreckers of dreams left a trail of broken promises in their wake.
meanings.sent5: The notorious wreckers were known for causing chaos wherever they went.

meanings.definition: A group of people who intentionally cause shipwrecks for profit.
meanings.sent1: The wreckers plotted to lure ships into dangerous waters to steal cargo.
meanings.sent2: Historically, wreckers were feared by sailors for their treacherous actions.
meanings.sent3: The greedy wreckers set up false signals to trick passing ships.
meanings.sent4: The wreckers' deceitful practices led to many vessels meeting a tragic end.
meanings.sent5: Legends spoke of the wreckers' cunning tactics to enrich themselves at sea.

meanings.definition: A machine or device used to dismantle or break down structures.
meanings.sent1: The construction crew brought in heavy wreckers to demolish the old building.
meanings.sent2: The wreckers efficiently tore down the walls to make space for a new development.
meanings.sent3: The noisy wreckers buzzed and clanked as they demolished the structure.
meanings.sent4: The wreckers roared to life, ready to turn the building into rubble.
meanings.sent5: The powerful wreckers made quick work of the demolition job.
